title: So fast on shipping out another one when 1 of 2 didn’t work
text: I have loved this speaker for the 3 and a half months I've had it. I use it in the bathroom when I shower. I hang it on my wall where it is not exposed to direct water or moiture, whereas this thing is designed to BE IN water. Welp, "loved" is past tense, as it no longer charges. 5 different USB cords, 2 different bricks AND my PC will not charge this thing to save my life. It's barely even been touched, it just... freaking hangs there lol! What a terrible product, and I cannot imagine for one SECOND that it holds up under all the activities it was "designed" for.Will never touch another Ultimate Ears product again. Should've stuck with JBL or Bose like my gut told me to.

title: DO NOT BUY: Ruined my relationship with ULTIMATE EARS :(
text: I've had different generations of the UE Booms, and I love that they are rugged and compact, with big sound. I can add a carabiner and clip to my back pack to bike around town. They just ALWAYS without fail, end up having bluetooth issues. You can't have more than one device syncable at the same time, meaning you have to factory reset it EVERY time you'd want to switch from your phone, to your computer, or to someone else's phone—YOU HAVE TO FACTORY RESET!! and then to switch back to your device, you have to factory reset again. It messes with the device and there's no fix for it. They only have a 2 year warranty, on hardware only womp womp. Try another device that actually gives you the convenience and flexibility of a bluetooth speaker :/

title: Beware!! Bad charger port after 14 weeks of very minimal usage
text:

 I have two opinions of the Ultimate Ears Boom speakers.When used as a single speaker, the Ultimate Ears Boom 3 speaker works well. The sound quality and loudness are good for a speaker of its size. The Bluetooth range is rather pathetic as I lose connection after moving about 20 feet away from the speaker's audio source, but I blame Bluetooth for being a lousy wireless standard more than the speaker for that fault. The speaker can be used every day in the shower with no negative repercussions. Overall, the Boom 3 speaker is a great speaker when used by itself.The situation completely changes when attempting to use two or more Boom speakers together. I'll go into details below, but I can confidently say that I've experienced few pieces of technology that are more unreliable and frustrating than the Boom 3 speakers when trying to get them paired together and playing the same audio.First, the Ultimate Ears Boom app is a huge frustration. Getting even a single speaker to show up in the app can require multiple disconnects, app force quits, and speaker restarts. Once a primary speaker shows up in the UE Boom app, getting other speakers to show up is near impossible. Each and every day I want to use the speakers together, I have to go through a 20-minute process of forgetting Bluetooth settings, repairing, and powering off and on speakers. It is such a frustrating process that I usually rage quit and forgo using the speakers together.Then, once the speakers are connected together they regularly start clicking and thumping as they stutter during audio playback. Even when I move the two speakers within a foot of each other and the audio source, they regularly and constantly stutter and lose bits of audio. Listening to an entire song without missing parts is impossible when using the Ultimate Ears Boom speakers together in Party Up or Two-Up mode.Simply put, THESE SPEAKERS DO NOT WORK WHEN PAIRED TOGETHER. The Boom speakers are completely worthless when used together as the audio they play is unlistenable.I really enjoyed the single Ultimate Ears Boom speaker I used on its own for about two years, but after experiencing the disaster which is Party Up mode and the Ultimate Ears Boom app, I will never again purchase another Ultimate Ears product. This experience has just been too frustrating and I've wasted $300 on two speakers I cannot use together.

title: Always want to love the UE Booms, but they always disappoint and FRUSTRATE
text: The sound is great, it links to my phone easily and the charge last a long time. It doesn't really matter if the sound is good if you can not turn it on. I bought this speaker when the old one went out after 10 years,  this one lasted about a month. You have to push very hard on the power button inorder to get the speaker to turn on and some time it will turn back off, you have to turn it on 3 or 4 times foe it tonstay on. I did not get the service plan, I guess a company needs to offer a service plan if you are unsure of the quality of your product. A better product would.come with a 100% guarantee,  for $150 in a competitive market I expected better quality.

title: The worst speaker every when used as two or more together
text: I've held out a long time before writing this review however I am getting horrible assistance from Ultimate Ear's support team.After a little more than a month after buying this product, it would no longer charge.  I'm sure I just got a lemon or something and I was barely past Amazon's return window so I turned to the manufacturer for support.It took them almost 3 weeks to reply to my original support ticket that explained in detail that the speaker I received will not power on and will not charge.I am probably on my 4th to 5th response from their support team requesting me to try different troubleshooting techniques such as 'factory reset' or 'update the firmware' all of which are impossible to do with a speaker that can't power on.I feel like there isn't even a person behind these support tickets.  Just a robot dishing automated responses out.When the speaker worked, it was decent to good; however, I felt that the battery life wasn't even close to what was advertised.  Mine lasted 45min - 1hr between charges.  It Could have just been my speaker since  I've had charging issues, idk at this point.

title: Power button
text: I WANT to love this speaker - the sound is so clear and loud considering its small size. But the battery life is truly abysmal. I can charge it overnight, check that it’s at 100%, and it’s giving me the “critical battery level” warning after like 30-40 minutes of use. Then to make matters worse, if I plug it in while continuing to play music the battery will still die anyway and then I have to wait like an hour or so for it to gain enough power to be turned back on. I’ve never had a speaker before that loses power faster than it gains it while plugged in. I don’t know if mine is just defective or if I’ve just been very lucky with other speakers, but it’s pretty disappointing.

title: Charge
text: Please, do not buy this speaker!!! Every time that you connect to the speaker A LITERAL VOICE SAYS: "To use this feature, please make sure your app is running and can access the Internet."This interrupts the music each time a device is connected. While this may seem like a mild annoyance - it makes me wish that I had returned the product before the return window closed. No app is necessary to run bluetooth, anyone using bluetooth audio would know this. The maker of the product should fix this immediately. I find it incredibly embarrassing to have to explain to my friends why this is happening. You would be better served buying another speaker.

Like every three minutes it’s either turning on and off or some things yelling at me. So with that being said I’ve only had it for five months and already broken. I realize I use it every day but isn’t that the point.Update I fixed the Stuck top middle button. I had to cut open the middle button and now it works. Before it did not make the Click feeling because it was stuck. Just have to avoid liquids by it.But…… This speaker started crackling. I have only had this speaker for about eight months.All in all not with the price since the main button was useless until I cut open the top and because this speaker is crackling.

title: DO NOT BUY: Ruined my relationship with ULTIMATE EARS :(
text: The Boom 3 wants you to launch the app every time you connect to the Boom 3. The vast majority of the time you dont want or need to open the app. The problem is that the boom 3 intrusively pauses music to remind you enable the app and it remains on pause after the reminder It would be that big of an inconvenience if it reminded you immediately. It waits a good 15-20 seconds before reminding you and pausing the music, however That means you are half way across the room or busy doing an activity when you have to go back, unlock your phone and start the music again.....It doesnt seem like a major flaw but its enough of an aggravation that I want to toss it in the trash every time it happens. I cant stand it when a manufacturer pesters you to activate a useless app and if you dont, they penalize/bother you.  I would go back to the Bose unit I have it wasnt on its death bed...Will not buy another Boom device.

title: Great product with one fatal flaw
text: I currently own  a boom 3 and a megaboom 3 .  When I first purchased my boom 3  I was pretty happy with it,  so I  invested in a charger base for it.  The charger base stopped working after approx 45 days.  After less than 1 year of use I started to notice issues with sound quality on my first boom 3 (mostly distortion at higher decibels). As a long time fan, and customer of Logitech products, I tried to convince myself that I was simply asking too much from such a small speaker. Hoping to achieve greater sound without giving up on the Brand entirely, I  also purchased a megaboom 3.  I was immediately disappointed with the megaboom 3 as a standalone product. Sound quality is very poor compared to other speakers demo'ed by acquaintances and doesn't even sound as good as the boom3 did back when it was new. There certainly IS more bass available, but it sounds absurd and completely non-representative of the actual music. Additionally, problems with the manufacturer's phone app continue to be a source of constant frustration. The only time I get decent sound out of EITHER of my two speakers now is if they are both paired up and in "party up" mode, which is a enormous inconvenience because the app is so buggy and I don't always have room in my gear for both speakers.If I were newly in the market for one or possibly two waterproof Bluetooth speakers I would try someone other than Logitech, and I will absolutely do so in the future.

title: this stopped working after 3 months
text: I was gifted this speaker for Christmas 2021 after extensive research into waterproof, floating, bluetooth speakers. We were finally able to take the speaker out over fourth of July weekend last week. Our first run out, the speaker did not float. In fact, it stopped playing music entirely when it touched the water. After much trial and error, we determined the speaker does not float. We ended up tying it to a life vest just to use it. Sometimes the waves would knock one end into the water and it sounded like the entire thing was submerged—just super muffled and quiet. Considering we purchased this one solely for its floating and waterproof capabilities, it’s a bit disappointing. I have plenty of other very nice speakers that aren’t waterproof and do not float that do the same job much better.

title: So fast on shipping out another one when 1 of 2 didn’t work
text: I really liked the sound quality of this speaker and it definitely seemed water-resistant, but mine is already broken after very, very light use (~10 -20 minutes once a week). The "magic" button is very hard to push down, and since it controls the skip track it's really annoying to have to push a button twice to go to the next song. There's also a bit of a delay from when you skip the track to the next track that I haven't seen with other (much) cheaper speakers.  Also,I was never able to actually use the magic button despite having authorized the speaker in my Alexa and BOOM app. Something I could live with (and have, since I bought it), but the fact that it's broken after minimal use plus the serious design flaw in the magic button/skip track difficulty makes me say this is just not worth the money.  Get some other cheaper and easier to use speaker.

title: Battery life is awful
text: So let's cut to the chase. Everything sounds good and it plays music via apps (Spotify app, Amazon music app, Pandora, etc).Now if you have audio from your phone coming from a phone call, internet chrome including on YouTube (not the app) via the browser, etc audio isn't picked up.  Now ssnding  audio to this device isn't easy.  If you just want to send a signal such as  a Amazon device to a Bluetooth speaker, etc this isn't the device for you and it's Bluetooth  is only partially functional.  Bluetooth only works with a few apps and major apps such as chrome, edgee, huge Samsung apps,  key iPhone apps, etc don't transmit any signal even if it's playing. It does not work like other devices such as Bose, Harman kardon, etc in which all audio from a connected device is sent over to the speakers. Only audio in which the app is open and paired is sent. So if you' have  a phone call going and an music app on your phone going, just the app will make sounds.  It would be nice if any device that connects it would play all audio from any source not from only a handful of apps.My recommendation is going with a full service Bluetooth device that works like normal (such as headsets in which all audio is transferred to the device). I tried this on the latest Galaxy devices and iphones with the same experience.Customer service is non existednt so  don't bother reaching out for help. They either ignore you with automated responses or they have people who do not understand the product working tthere following a script.

text: I have purchased four Boom products. All have worked for a short period of time. A great concept! At some point Boom needs to get it right! I can no longer support purchasing products from you that have design flaws. Boom returned a few and now that had flaws and I am now loosing track. I exchange these products between my teenage son and I, and honestly I get dumped with the garbage. I can't fund your product development anymore! You need to release stable products and not rely on purchases/returns to grow your business and new product developement. I don't care if I end up spending $5000 for a product you sell for $0.50. Boom has no credibility and I never want to see or hear from you again! I hope you go out of business! What a Brand you have developed! SMH!

title: Don’t last long
text: I’ve had this speaker for over a year. It has stopped pairing with my iPhone. The reset feature worked once and has not worked again. My phone won’t recognize it. I’ve wasted so much time on this crappy little speaker, I would definitely not recommend it to anyone. Don’t waste your money! It’s going in the recycle trash.

title: I love the concept but need to draw the line funding Boom's Product Development Efforts
text: I received this as a Christmas present and it quit taking a charge. I call the company and they have me do a few things and inform it is broken and I would have to fill out their warranty. I did everything they ask and then they don’t cover their product. I now have a two month old paper weight. What a garbage company to not handle this properly.

title: Quit Pairing
text: Tons of firmware issues! Volume down button doesn’t decrease sound at all, only tells you the batter percentage. Volume up button gets stuck all the time. Doesn’t turn off when you hit the power button, have to turn off using the app. The “skip song” button stopped working altogether. Always issues connecting over Bluetooth. Emailed company about issues since this is brand new & all they said back was “ya we know, this has been a major issues lately, try these trouble shooting steps” which did nothing at all. Lousy customer service and definitely NOT worth the price. Do not recommend!

title: So fast on shipping out another one when 1 of 2 didn’t work
text: The app that accompanies this product is terrible. It ruins the enjoyment and operation of this device.

title: Don't buy if its on discount.
text: had it for 5 months. the software logitech uses to power it's blutooth connectivity now cuts out for a couple seconds periodically. the battery is questionable healthy. reads 100% then 20% ten seconds later (all over the place really). but it's the hardware/software powering the blutooth that's the main culprit here. day one the range was all over my house. now if it's not 2 feet from the device it drops connection.  I could have gotten a faulty one, but troubleshooting through my issues lead me reading up on others with the same blutooth connectivity failures.tldr. poor blutooth implentation with brick your speaker. you've been warned

title: Not satisfied
text: Not at all something worth 12K. The reviews are misleading. The sound quality really feels cheap. Not loud enough, not at all punchy bass. Feels like there's no bass at all. My Amazon Echo (2nd gen) is much better than this in terms of sound quality. I tried various genres of music. It failed miserably in each of them. Really a blunder in the name of a speaker. I want to return this product and get a refund. Didn't check the battery life yet as I was disgusted with the sound quality. Will post about that soon. But even if it is 15 hours, I doubt you'll be able to listen to this for more than an hour, it's that bad. Not at all value for money. Buy any other speaker worth 5-6 K. I think that will be better than this.
